page.title: 07RECREATION
page.content: Apart from the usual "in home" entertainment people must either make their own or travel elsewhere. The library van comes once in 3 weeks, though there is a permanent library in Appleby. The village institute provides a social centre for activities such as whist and domino drives, badminton and W.I meetings. There is an annual "Gala", mid July, with children's sports and a fancy dress compeition, and a small local produce show. Elsewhere in the Eden Valley one can join a choir or brass-band, or take part in local drama. Appleby has sporting facilties for tennis, bowls,football and swimming. .
